jot.physics.particle_system.SPH

Class ParticleSystemSPH

  • java.lang.Object
    • jot.physics.particle_system.SPH.ParticleSystemSPH
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ParticleSystem

    public class ParticleSystemSPH
extends Object
implements ParticleSystem
    Class that implements a generic simplistic particle system.
    Author:
    G. Amador & A. Gomes

      Inverse of the if a fluid particle approaches a boundary particle, this distance is used to determine, whether it will feel repulsive force.

      Inverse of the density the fluid would have if it was at rest, used to initialize particles and calculate the pressure.

      Inverse of the unit length used in the equations.

      Volume of a particle used to calculate the particle mass.

      Power of 2 of the if a fluid particle approaches a boundary particle, this distance is used to determine, whether it will feel repulsive force.
      static float REPULSIVE_DISTANCE
      If a fluid particle approaches a boundary particle, this distance is used to determine, whether it will feel repulsive force.
      static float REST_DENSITY
      The density the fluid would have if it was at rest, used to initialize particles and calculate the pressure.
      static float SMOOTHING_LENGTH
      The radius in which particles will interact with each other.

      Power of 2 of the radius in which particles will interact with each other.
      static float TIMESTEP
      Time stepping constant.
      static float UNIT_SCALE
      The unit length used in the equations.
      static float V_ALPHA
      One of the two constants used for the shear-and-bulk viscosity.
      static float V_BETA
      One of the two constants used for the shear-and-bulk viscosity.
      static float WORLD_SCALE
      Scale constant used to map between pixel space and world space.
      static float XSPH_EPSILON
      The epsilon factor used in the xSPH variant to provide more orderly high-speed flows (makes the simulation more stable too).

    • Field Detail

      • GWIDTH

        public static final int GWIDTH
        The display Window width.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • GHEIGHT

        public static final int GHEIGHT
        The display Window height.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DAMPING

        public static float DAMPING
        Damping used in the integration step. Feels a bit hacky, but looks nicer.

      • HEAT_RATIO

        public static float HEAT_RATIO
        The ratio of heat transmission.

      • V_ALPHA

        public static float V_ALPHA
        One of the two constants used for the shear-and-bulk viscosity. Should not be altered at the moment, since this might induce cancer.

      • V_BETA

        public static float V_BETA
        One of the two constants used for the shear-and-bulk viscosity. Should not be altered at the moment, since this might induce cancer.

      • TIMESTEP

        public static float TIMESTEP
        Time stepping constant. The simulation will run faster if the time step is set higher, but the accuracy will decrease.

      • UNIT_SCALE

        public static final float UNIT_SCALE
        The unit length used in the equations. you might choose this to be smaller, but don't forget to adjust the rest density.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • INV_UNIT_SCALE

        public static float INV_UNIT_SCALE
        Inverse of the unit length used in the equations. you might choose this to be smaller, but don't forget to adjust the rest density.

      • WORLD_SCALE

        public static final float WORLD_SCALE
        Scale constant used to map between pixel space and world space. You can set this smaller if you want to fit more water on the screen.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • INV_WORLD_SCALE

        public static final float INV_WORLD_SCALE
        Inverse of the scale constant used to map between pixel space and world space. You can set this smaller if you want to fit more water on the screen.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • INV_REPULSIVE_DISTANCE

        public static float INV_REPULSIVE_DISTANCE
        Inverse of the if a fluid particle approaches a boundary particle, this distance is used to determine, whether it will feel repulsive force.

      • REPULSIVE_DIST_SQ

        public static float REPULSIVE_DIST_SQ
        Power of 2 of the if a fluid particle approaches a boundary particle, this distance is used to determine, whether it will feel repulsive force.

      • REPULSIVE_D

        public static float REPULSIVE_D
        Force scale for the repulsive force between fluid and boundary particles.

      • SMOOTHING_LENGTH_SQ

        public static float SMOOTHING_LENGTH_SQ
        Power of 2 of the radius in which particles will interact with each other.

      • INV_SMOOTHING_LENGTH

        public static float INV_SMOOTHING_LENGTH
        Different kernel normalization factors and their derivatives used for smoothing attributes between particles.

      • D_KERNEL_FACTOR

        public static final float D_KERNEL_FACTOR
        Poly6.

      • P_KERNEL_FACTOR

        public static float P_KERNEL_FACTOR
        Spiky (gradient).

      • D_KERNEL_FACTOR_GRADIENT

        public static float D_KERNEL_FACTOR_GRADIENT
        Poly6 derivative (I//m not sure if this one is right, since I had to calculate it on my own).

      • PARTICLE_AREA

        public static float PARTICLE_AREA
        Volume of a particle used to calculate the particle mass.

      • XSPH_EPSILON

        public static float XSPH_EPSILON
        The epsilon factor used in the xSPH variant to provide more orderly high-speed flows (makes the simulation more stable too).

        Gravity.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Reset the particle system, to an initial configuration.

      • freeRect

        public void freeRect(float Startx,
                     float Starty,
                     float Endx,
                     float Endy)
        Removes all fluid and boundary particles that are inside the specified rectangle.
        Parameters:
        Startx - the min x value in OpenGL coordinates of the rectangle.
        Starty - the min y value in OpenGL coordinates of the rectangle.
        Endx - the max x value in OpenGL coordinates of the rectangle.
        Endy - the max x value in OpenGL coordinates of the rectangle.
